revisions.rev:
{{Infobox national football team | Name = France | Flag = Flag of France.svg | Badge = | FIFA Trigramme = FRA | Nickname = Les Bleuets (The Little Blues)
Les Tricolores (The Tri-colours) | Association = [[French Football Federation]] | Confederation = [[UEFA]] (Europe) | Coach = [[Pierre Mankowski]] | Captain = [[Paul Pogba]] | Most caps = | Top scorer = | pattern_la1 =_fra11h|pattern_ra1=_fra11h|pattern_b1=_fra11h | pattern_ra1 =_fra11h|pattern_so1=_fra11h|pattern_sh1=_fra11h | pattern_so1 =_fra11h| leftarm1=2225AA|body1=2225AA|rightarm1=2225AA|shorts1=FFFFFF | socks1 = FF0000 | pattern_la2 =_fra11a|pattern_b2=_fra11a|pattern_ra2=_fra11a | pattern_sh2 = |pattern_so2=| leftarm2=FFFFFF|body2=FFFFFF | rightarm2 = FFFFFF|shorts2=2225AA|socks2=FFFFFF }} The '''France national under-19 football team''' is the national under-19 football team of [[France]] and is controlled by the [[French Football Federation]]. The team competes in the annual [[UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship]]. They were the [[2010 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2010 champions]] of the competition having won on home soil. The under-19 team also contests the qualification matches needed to play in the [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]], though the competition is classified as an under-20 tournament. France have won the UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship twice in 2005 and 2010. In 2005, [[striker]] [[Abdoulaye BaldÃ© (footballer)|Abdoulaye BaldÃ©]] was awarded the Golden Player award.{{cite news | url = http://www.uefa.com/under19/history/season=2005/goldenplayer/index.html | title = 2005: Abdoulaye Balde | date = 1 April 2008 | work = [[UEFA|Union of European Football Associations]] | accessdate = 10 August 2010}} However, of the twenty-one players that played on the 2005 championship-winning team, only three of them have played in the [[France national football team|senior team]] of France; [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] [[Hugo Lloris]] and [[midfielder]]s [[Abou Diaby]] and [[Yoann Gourcuff]]. Two players, [[Djamel Abdoun]] and [[Moussa Sow]], have played for other national teams for which they were eligible. In 2010, the team was crowned champions on home soil after defeating [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain]] 2â1 in the final in [[Caen]]. [[GaÃ«l Kakuta]] was named the tournament's Golden Player.{{cite news | url = http://www.uefa.com/under19/history/season=2010/goldenplayer/index.html | title = 2010: GaÃ«l Kakuta | date = 2 August 2010 | work = [[UEFA|Union of European Football Associations]] | accessdate = 10 August 2010}} The 2011â12 international under-19 campaign began in September 2011 and the current under-19 team is coached by [[Pierre Mankowski]], [[Pierre Mankowski]], a former football player, notably for [[Amiens SC]] and [[RC Lens|Lens]].{{cite news | url= http://www.francefootball.fr/FF/breves2010/20100803_134203_mankowski-selectionneur-des-u18.html | title = Mankowski sÃ©lectionneur des U18 | date = 3 August 2010 | accessdate = 3 August 2010 | publisher = [[France Football]] | language = French}} From 2002â2010, Mankowski served as the assistant coach for the [[France national football team|France senior team]] and, following Domenech's departure in July 2010, was not retained by new manager [[Laurent Blanc]]. The current captain of the team is [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] [[midfielder]] [[Paul Pogba]]. == Players == === Current squad === *The following players have been called up to participate in a training camp to be held through 7â10 November 2011.{{cite news | url= http://www.fff.fr/individus/selections/der_selection.php?id_selection=6 | title = Stage Ã  Clairefontaine du lundi 07 novembre 2011 au jeudi 10 novembre 2011 | date = 28 October 2011 | accessdate = 29 October 2011 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}} ''Caps and goals are as current as the squad's previous match against Portugal on 9 October 2011.
